articles.description: Argentina are outsiders for their Rugby World Cup semi-final and New Zealand's accuracy and desire make it hard to argue with the bookmakers' odds.
articles.title: Argentina caught in path of All Blacks juggernaut

articles.description: Second row Maro Itoje tells his England team-mates to disregard the past and ignore the future to focus fully on upsetting South Africa in their Rugby World Cup semi-final.
articles.title: Itoje urges England to seize the day to shock Boks

articles.description: Virat Kohli scores his 48th one-day international hundred as India power to a seven-wicket win over Bangladesh.
articles.title: Kohli ton powers India to victory over Bangladesh

articles.description: Leading Formula 1 drivers express shock at a decision to raise the possible fine that can be imposed on competitors to 1m euros (£871,000).
articles.title: F1 drivers shocked at fine increase to 1m euros

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Joelah & Keke of Radio 1Xtra's Throwback Party in this weekend's Premier League game predictions.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League predictions v 1Xtra's Joelah & Keke

articles.description: Replays in the third and fourth rounds of the FA Cup and two-legged EFL Cup semi-finals are expected to be scrapped as part of reforms to the English football calendar.
articles.title: FA Cup replays could be scrapped in calendar reform

articles.description: Watch Virat Kohli hit a six to seal India's seven-wicket victory over Bangladesh and bring up his century in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 match in Pune.
articles.title: Kohli hits six to bring up century and seal India win

articles.description: South Africa wicketkeeper Sinalo Jafta on reaching a year of sobriety after fearing alcoholism would end her career.
articles.title: 'I'm alive, sober & grateful' - SA's Jafta on alcoholism recovery

articles.description: Wayne Rooney calls rumours of his reported salary "a load of rubbish" as he prepares for his first game as Birmingham boss.
articles.title: Birmingham wage rumours 'a load of rubbish' - Rooney

articles.description: Freddie Steward, Joe Marler and George Martin come into the England side to take on South Africa in the Rugby World Cup semi-final on Saturday.
articles.title: Steward, Marler & Martin in for England semi-final
